articles.author: Amruta Khandekar, Shristi A
articles.description: Wall Street's main indexes pared losses on Friday as weakness in megacap growth stocks was countered by gains in defensive sectors and energy firms, while investors looked forward to commentary by Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell next week.
articles.title: Wall St cuts losses as energy, defensive sectors counter megacap declines

articles.author: Anirban Sen
articles.description: SoftBank Group Corp (9984.T) has acquired the 25% stake in Arm Ltd it does not directly own from its Vision Fund unit in a deal that values the chip designer at $64 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.
articles.title: SoftBank buys Vision Fund's stake in Arm at valuation of $64 bln-sources

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Top cryptocurrency bitcoin hit a fresh two-month low on Friday, breaking out of its recent tight range, as a wave of risk off sentiment grips world markets.
articles.title: Bitcoin drops to new two-month low as world markets sell off

articles.author: Tim Hepher, Lisa Baertlein, Allison Lampert, Valerie Insinna
articles.description: Air cargo enjoyed record demand when COVID-19 closed borders and snarled supply chains. Now, it is reeling from overcapacity and tumbling freight rates as the freight boom makes a hard landing.
articles.title: Air travel boom creates crosswinds for air cargo

articles.author: Ben Klayman
articles.description: Vietnamese electric-vehicle maker VinFast, which made a splash this week when its shares debuted on the Nasdaq, has stirred a mix of caution and interest among dealers with a recent change in how it will distribute its cars in the U.S. market.
articles.title: Focus: VinFast's new sales approach has US car dealers cautious but interested

articles.author: Richa Naidu, Martin Coulter
articles.description: Some of the world's biggest advertisers, from food giant Nestle (NESN.S) to consumer goods multinational Unilever (ULVR.L), are experimenting with using generative AI software like ChatGPT and DALL-E to cut costs and increase productivity, executives say.
articles.title: From Mad Men to machines? Big advertisers shift to AI

articles.author: Amy-Jo Crowley, Emma-Victoria Farr, Milana Vinn
articles.description: Dalian Wanda Group, owned by China's once-richest man Wang Jianlin, is seeking to sell its sports marketing unit Infront as financial pressure mounts on the property developer to shore up its finances, four people familiar with the matter told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Dalian Wanda weighs sale of Olympics media rights manager Infront -sources

articles.author: Special Reports
articles.description: How drug cartels evade authorities by using money transfers popular with migrant workers to send their earnings back to Mexico.
articles.title: How Mexican narcos use remittances to wire U.S. drug profits home

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, David Brunnstrom, Hyonhee Shin
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden and the leaders of South Korea and Japan agreed at Camp David on Friday to deepen military and economic ties, and made their strongest condemnation yet of "dangerous and aggressive behavior" by China in the South China Sea.
articles.title: At Camp David, US, South Korea and Japan agree to deepen military ties, condemn China

articles.author: Deena Beasley
articles.description: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said on Thursday that it was tracking a new, highly mutated lineage of the virus that causes COVID-19.
articles.title: US CDC tracks new lineage of virus that causes COVID
